channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bukele Has Power to Return Deportee to U.S., Experts Say
item.description: Experts say President Nayib Bukele has the power but not the interest to return a man deported from Maryland to El Salvador in error.

item.title: As Fentanyl Deaths Slow, Meth Comes for Maine
item.description: A powerful stimulant that keeps users sleepless for days and can ignite psychosis and violence has been rattling Portland and its safety networks.

item.title: Israel Threatens Further Escalation in Gaza War
item.description: The United Nations warned that the humanitarian situation in Gaza was likely at its worst since the conflict began and that the population was again o...

item.title: Bank of America CFO says business owners seek clarity on trade policy and prepare for a ‘slow-growth environment’
item.description: Despite uncertainty employment remains healthy, and consumers have proven resilient, BofA finds.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs can be beneficial in the long term but Congress needs a more active role, says top GOP lawmaker
item.description: As chair of the House Financial Services Committee, Hill is helping shepherd key crypto legislation.

item.title: Fake LinkedIn profiles, Webex, and Fiverr: Inside the North Korean IT worker scheme roiling the Fortune 500
item.description: The IT worker scam has impacted Fortune 500 companies that authorities say unwittingly hired thousands of North Korean engineers pretending to be Amer...

item.title: California Is Preparing to Sue Trump to Stop His Tariffs
item.description: State officials argue in a lawsuit that the U.S. Constitution expressly gives the authority to impose tariffs to Congress.

item.title: Burglars tunnel through concrete wall into LA jewelry store and steal $10 million in watches, pendants and gold chains
item.description: The heist wasn't discovered until store employees arrived for work Monday morning.

item.title: Jamie Dimon fears reading a book in 40 years on ‘How the West was lost’ over military spending rows and tariff tactics
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon's chief concern is that tariffs could prove a tipping point in the influence of the Western world.

item.title: What to Know About Today’s Meth
item.description: The highly addictive drug, manufactured almost exclusively by Mexican cartels, is more dangerous than ever. Its use has been surging across the countr...

item.description: Britain’s Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday that trans women do not meet the legal definition of female under the country’s Equality Act. However, the ...

item.title: Bukele Has Power to Return Deportee to U.S., Experts Say
item.description: Experts say President Nayib Bukele has the power but not the interest to return a man deported from Maryland to El Salvador in error.

item.title: Italy’s Meloni Heads to Washington to Meet Trump. Will It Pay Off for Europe?
